frame.name: Armor
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Asset</fen>, the safety of which is desirable, is protected from damage by a covering, the <fen>Armor</fen>. The <fen>Armor</fen> covers part or all of the <fen>Asset</fen> and is designed to absorb force from an oncoming <fen>Danger</fen>.
<ex>They were wearing nothing but primitive <fex name="mat">wooden</fex> <t><fex name="Armor">armor</fex></t>.</ex>
<ex>An extra level of safety is provided by <fex name="Asset">the soldiers'</fex> <fex name="Danger">ballistic</fex> <t><fex name="Armor">armor</fex></t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Armor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Armor</fen> prevents the <fen>Asset</fen> from coming to harm.
<ex>Metal <t><fex name="arm">armor</fex></t> was so heavy that sometimes knights found it difficult to move.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Danger
FE.definition:
<def-root>An object or situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Danger">anti-mine</fex> <t>armor</t> being developed by the army is still months from completion.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Asset
FE.definition:
<def-root>Something desirable which might be lost or damaged and which is protected by <fen>Armor</fen>.
<ex>Our company's <fex name="Asset">tank</fex> <t>armor</t> provides an unprecedented about of protection.</ex>
<ex>The bullet was stopped by <fex name="Asset">her</fex> <t>bullet-proof vest</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description or characteristic of the <fen>Armor</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="des">rusted</fex> <t>mail</t> provided little protection against his foe's broadsword.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Armor</fen> protects the <fen>Asset</fen>, e.g., how resilient it is.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Material</fen> which the <fen>Armor</fen> is primarily made of. <ex>It is now common for officers to wear <fex name="mat">kevlar</fex> <t>bullet-proof vests</t>.</ex></def-root >

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place on the <fen>Asset</fen> covered by the <fen>Armor</fen>.
<ex>Tanks will now be fitted with <fex name="sub">underbelly</fex> <t>armor</t> to protect against roadside bombs.</ex>
<ex>This style of <fex name="sub">chest</fex> <t>armor</t> was used in Japan during the 11th century.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: armor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a solid layer of protection against attacks.

lexUnit.name: mail.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: armor composed of interlinked rings.

lexUnit.name: bulletproof vest.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: armor that covers the torso and back, providing protection against bullets and other projectiles.
